question: hobby?...maybe thats the wrong word.....?
question_content:
Kay.

I don't realy have anything that I do. basically all day I watch TV, hang out with friends, walk around my neighborhood or whatever. but like I want something to do, ya know? like im starting high school in the fall, im gonna try out for volleyball. but like idk....I waned to do boxing but my mom wouldn't let me. I was thinking something fun, easy, but not too easy and that might help me lose a little weight. (like twenty pounds) 

also-
im not very good at sports.

and i was thinking dance, but most people who do that have done it since they were little, id look stupid.

answers.answer_content: cheerleading! just be careful and choose your friends wisely. dont get caught up in the bad stuff. good luck!!!

Ya know, I have been in the same position, and I'm going to be a Senior in high school next year, but I finally got fed up with the boring-ness of where I live, and tried out for Cheerleading. It's really fun, well, at least from the couple practices I've had, it was amazing! I wish I would have started a lot sooner, so start now, try out for Volleyball, or do dance, just do something to get active.

How about bike riding, swimming, kickboxing, or self defense? 
If your mom didn't want you to get into boxing for the simple reason you're female and boxing isn't considered feminine enough, try talking to her about taking self defense. You can argue the fact that not only is it good exercise but just something you can learn if you ever need to protect yourself. And, if you enjoy it, maybe that can somehow lead you into boxing (if you're still interested in it) and possibly, your mom will back you up after some time.

Biking and swimming are good too, because they can be done either alone or with others as well as just for fun or as exercise. You can also choose to take it easy or really push yourself with either sport. 
If you have access to a racquetball court and any interest, racquetball can be fun too...especially on a bad day. It's good to whack a ball around the court as hard as possible to de-stress. And, it's a great workout as well.

There's nothing wrong with dancing.  You could take ballroom or something like that, which is good exercise.  Don't worry about looking silly.  You'll be put into a class with beginners like you anyways, so you'll all get  to look silly together :-)

Otherwise, if you can't take boxing, what about Karate or Tae-Kwon-Do or another martial art?  Still good exercise.

Go dancing, no worries, it's ok to do it later then the others, no one is going to make fun of you. But if I didn't convince you with dancing try swimming. Just get a one those pool cards which allow you to go swim any time you want, you'll lose some weight +build you're body.
Good luck
You can still try dancing just not ballet because it's too late to start that. But there are tons of other dances to learn, so you could still try it..no worries.

try tennis I tryed out but didn't finish it and I was stupid cause I love tennis but thats a really good and easy sport.
you could also try Ice skating, bowling, stuff like that.
anyway I g2g 2 skool so hope I helped 
~GOOD LUCK!!!!~

try water aerobiocs! its great fun !
or cheerleading. 
join as many clubs as you can to begin with and then if you dont like it you can easily drop out. You might end up enjoying it .
